loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат родился в 1969 года. Он разведен и имеет одного сына. Шухрат более 30 лет работает в средней школе. Он преподает информатику. Шухрат всегда мечтал, чтобы ее сын пошел по его стопам. Он отправил сына в Литву. Его сын учится в университете. Он умный и успешный студент. Шухрат должен оплатить за учебу своего сына. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shuhrat was born in 1969. He is divorced and has one son. For more than 30 years, Shuhrat has been working in a high school. He teaches informatics. Shuhrat always dreamed that his son would follow in his footsteps. He sent his son to Lithuania. His son studies at a university. He is a clever and successful student. Shuhrat must pay for his son's schooling. He is requesting a loan of US$4,000.

loans.use: A loan of $4,000 helps Shuhrat to pay for the education of his son who studies abroad.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran is a resident from Bakan district, the most populous area in Pursat province. As other villagers do, Ran is in the business of growing rice and other seasonal crops to sell. Her common-law husband is also involved in farming activities and helps her maintain their crops. This couple has two children living with them in their own home. 

Ran wants to promote their health and live in good conditions. Therefore, she has requested a loan to buy materials and pay for labor costs to build a latrine. Having a latrine to use in the household means that she and her family members can live a healthier lifestyle. She thanks Kiva lenders and Kiva partner HKL for helping low-income people gain access to sanitation and personal hygiene. HKL has provided her a special interest rate and suitable loan terms for this loan.

loans.use: to buy materials and to pay labor costs to build a latrine

loans.name: Rang

texts.en:
Rang is 34 years old, married and has two dependent children living with her and her husband in a rural village of Siem Reap province. Rang is a hardworking woman who pays much attention to taking care of her family and also helps her husband generate income by working as a construction worker, earning a wage of $5.00 per day.

Rang would like to buy a motorcycle to help with their transportation needs, but she has inadequate money. So, she has applied for a loan in the amount of 800 US dollars from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner. This purchase will allow her to save on daily traveling costs and save enough for the family’s emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help with the family's transportation needs.

loans.name: Kolap

texts.en:
Kolap, aged 49, is an industrious mother of three children. They are living with her and her husband in a rural village in Siem Reap Province. To make a better living, she has been running a business of farming rice and distilling white wine from her own home. She earns a net profit of $5.00 dollar per day in this business. She works long hours a day and thinks her work is going well because she is very responsible. 

To assist in bringing in additional income, her husband now works as construction worker in a far away region. Every day, her husband needs to pay for motor-taxi to travel to his workplace. Therefore, in order to save some money, she decided to apply for a loan of 900 USD dollars for the purchase of a used motorbike. She hopes this loan will support her family and enable them to gain more profit. They are very thankful to all kind of lenders who always support her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to support her husband in his travelling needs.

loans.name: Gilos

texts.ru: Гилос родилась в 1990 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она в средней школе была одной из успешных учениц и всегда мечтала стать учительницей как ее мать. Она поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет по специальности Педагогика и психология. Гилос учится на 3 курсе. Гилос планирует после окончания университета работать в средней школе ее района. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора.
texts.en: Gilos was born in 1990.  She is married and raising one child.  When she was in high school, she was one of the best students, and she has always dreamed about becoming a teacher, like her mother.  She is enrolled as a third-year student at the Khujand State University, specializing in Education and Psychology.  After graduation, Gilos plans to work in a local secondary school.  She is taking a loan to pay her tuition fees.

loans.use: to finance her education.

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en:
Sreang is a resident living in a small village in the Kampong Cham province. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Her primary source of income is rice farming. It’s a traditional family farming, which was passed on for generations. Thanks to her parents, who taught her in the field, she inherited a few pieces of farmland after she got married to her husband. She has been a farmer for nearly 30 years. 

Sreang would like to increase the value of her house and promote her family's health with a latrine. She applied for a loan through HKL. She will use the loan to buy construction materials for building a latrine and pay for labor costs. She is grateful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than its general loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a latrine as well as pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Sokhkak

texts.en: Sokhkak is 19 years old and a single man living with his parents in Kep province. He is staff working for a guest house, earning a normal salary of $110.00 per month. Sokhkak graduated from high school in 2012 and continued studying at CUS University. He is a second-year student, majoring in law. Sokhkak, through savings from his small salary, could afford to pay for his first academic-year course. However, he now is facing difficulty to pay for his education fees again, so he decided to borrow a loan from HKL in the amount of 500 US dollars to cover his education costs. Sokhkak, pictured here, is committed to study hard with the funds from this loan. His parents, who are not included in the picture, will be his joint borrowers and also responsible for principal repayments. He expresses thanks to his parents and appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to programs like Kiva via its partners, HKL which have supported his education individually as well as other students.

loans.use: to cover his education costs.

loans.name: Chn

texts.en:
Chn is a 42-year-old married mother of four adult children living together with her and her husband in Kampong Cham province. Chn has been a farmer for nearly 10 years, growing and harvesting rice and other items. She is a hard worker who puts very much effort into improving her business and developing her family’s socioeconomic situation. Through her hardships, Chn hopes to provide enough for her children and at least help them finish high school.

Chn is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner to buy fertilizers to sow on her cucumber crops. This loan will allow her to have a better harvest, which she can sell in the market for a good profit. As for the future, Chn is willing to support and develop her business through buying some farming machines to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cucumber crops.

loans.name: Poeurn

texts.en:
Poeurn is 60 years old and is very responsible with his household obligations. He has always been known to provide the best for his family. He has a big family of 12 members. He currently lives with his wife and three unmarried children in his own home located in Bakan district, Pursat province. He is a farmer who plants and harvest rice both for sustenance and sales.

Poeurn wants to promote their health and allow them to live in good conditions. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to buy materials needed to build a latrine and pay for labor costs. By having a latrine to use in the household, Poeurn and his family members can live a healthy lifestyle. He thanks lenders for donating their money through a program like Kiva via its partners, HKL to help low-income people gain access to sanitation and personal hygiene. For water loan products, HKL has provided a special interest rate and more suitable loan terms than for its general products.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build a latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Lutfullobek

texts.ru: Лутфуллобеку 20 лет. Он порядочный и добродушный человек. Лутфуллобек успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Он учится на втором курсе. Лутфуллобек в свободное от учебы время помогает своим родителям по выращиванию сельхоз культур. Он трудолюбивый молодой человек. Лутфуллобек еще не женился. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lutfullobek is an honest and good-natured 20-year-old man who is not yet married. He successfully graduated from high school and entered university, where he is now a second-year student. When he is not studying, Lutfullobek helps his parents with their agricultural work. He is a hardworking young man. Lutfullobek needs to pay his university tuition but does not have the money, so he is requesting a loan to cover the cost. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Améléyassi

texts.fr:
Améléyassi est une femme âgé(e) de 35 ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant. Elle a 02 enfants tous scolarisés.
Améléyassi travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis quelques années. Elle revend des pagnes au marché à toutes personnes et s'approvisionne à Lomé.
Améléyassi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes. Elle veut acheter un terrain
Dans les prochaines années, Améléyassi voudrait avoir une boutique de vente de pagnes. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d'assurer les meilleures conditions de vie à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Améléyassi is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a teacher and has two children who both attend school.
Améléyassi has been selling traditional pagne cloth (highly colourful and decorative West African sarong-like clothing) for the past few years. She sells the pagne at market to all sorts of customers, and gets her supplies in Lomé. Améléyassi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy some pagne. She would like to buy some land. In the coming years, Améléyassi would like to have her own shop selling pagne. She plans to use her profits to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy traditional pagne cloth

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 24ans, Komlan pour subvenir à ses besoins a démarré la vente des produits informatiques en 2009 dans une boutique. Son premier crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Il espère devenir grossiste et fonder plus tard un foyer.
texts.en: Komlan is a 24-year old man who began selling computer products in a shop in 2009, so that he could provide for his own needs. His first loan will enable him to buy more goods and respond better to customer demand. He hopes to become a wholesaler later on and start a family.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Afin de subvenir à ses propres besoins, Béatrice revend des pagnes à domicile. Elle est célibataire et n'a pas d'enfants en charge. Elle espère ouvrir une grande boutique à l'avenir et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en: Béatrice sells "pagnes" (pieces of brightly colored fabric) from home in order to provide for her own needs. She is single and has no dependants. She hopes to open a large shop in the future and to be able to provide for herself even better.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes".

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est une femme de 44ans. Elle a pour mari un magasinier et mère de 03 enfants tous sur les bancs d'école. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré la vente des chaussures depuis 2012 à domicile et de façon ambulante.Son prêt lui permettra d' acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille. Elle espère diversifier ses produits et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Dédé is a 44-year-old woman. Her husband is a storekeeper and she is a mother to three children who all attend school. In order to meet to her family's needs, she started up her own travelling shoe sale home business in 2012. Her loan will allow her to buy more merchandise in order to better meet her family's needs. She plans to diversify her stock and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Pour acheter plus de marchandises, madame Akossiwa sollicite de WAGES un second prêt. Elle est revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale depuis 2009 et s'approvisionne à Lomé. Elle espère à l'avenir ouvrir une boutique et assurer une bonne condition de vie à la famille. Âgée de 44ans, elle est mariée à un commerçant et mère de 02 enfants(18 et 07ans) tous scolarisés.
texts.en: Akossiwa is requesting a second loan from WAGES so she can buy more goods. She has been selling groceries since 2009 and gets her supplies in Lomé. She hopes to be able to open a shop in the future and ensure good living conditions for her family. She is 44 years old, married to a trader and mother to two children (18 and seven years old respectively), both of whom are at school.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.en: Aigul is a bachelor degree student who studies in the local public university. She has chosen her major as history and socialism. She is very interested about this area. Her dream is to have influence and create a better place to live around the province where she lives, and then start impacting other provinces. She is a very hardworking student. This loan will help her to pay her tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace his tires with winter tires for safety, and purchase materials and other inventory items for his wife to tailor and make more clothes.

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Mr.Enhjargal is 56 years old lives with his wife in a small house in Zuunharaa soum of Selenge province in Mongolia. His wife, Oyuntsetseg, grows organic vegetables in their plot of land and sells to local retailers. Their children have gotten married and live apart from the couple.

Enhjargal has been operating a small carpentry services business since 2000. He built a small workplace right next to their own house and started manufacturing Ger, the traditional nomadic tent, parts and wooden furniture to local residents. He has been praised by his clients over the years with his quick but quality products. He is now requesting loan of 1,650,000MNT to purchase inventory to meet client's orders right on time and to make them happy with his products.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to meet client's order right on time and to make them happy with his products.

loans.name: Enhmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhmaa is 28 years old and lives in Zuunharaa soum of Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband Mongonholog and herself are herders and produce organic dairy products to sell to retailers. Her 2 sons, ages under 4, stay at home in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent.
 
Enhmaa and her husband started breeding livestock in 2009, and now own 19 cattle and 2 horses. She produces organic dairy products and supplies to local retailers. 

She is planning to increase the number of cattle in order to increase milk production. She is now requesting loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase cattle to increase her production and sales. She and her husband are hardworking, neat, and helpful people.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to increase her production and sales.

loans.name: Nasandelger

texts.en:
Nasandelger is a bachelor degree student who studies in public university to be a teacher of the Mongolian Russian language. She is very passionate to study. She is a hardworking and very organized student. 

By getting this loan, Nasandelger is able to study in her final year. When she graduates, she will be able to work as a interpreter in private enterprises, especially in companies that get investments from Russia. This loan will help her to pay tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children, who are both attending school. 

He has owned a barbershop since 1999. He is a friendly person and welcomes customers cheerfully. This is how he is able to let his customers become loyal to him because of his extraordinary reception. 

Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renovate and redecorate his shop. Unfortunately, his shop was moderately damaged by fire and he is in urgent need to complete the renovation to receive customers and be able able to serve them appropriately.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He has worked in the agricultural field for the past four years. He is specialized at removing smashed vegetation from farms, gardens and grounds in order to keep the nature in good condition and environmentally soothing to let people enjoy the nature and its green particularities.

With his youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., Ali will purchase new agricultural tools for his business to improve his work. This is his second Kiva loan and Vitas notes that Ali was a very good client with prompt payments.

loans.use: to purchase new agricultural tools.

loans.name: Amandikh

texts.en: Mr. Amandikh is a bachelor's degree student who studies in a local public university for a history and socialism degree. He has chosen his major based on his interests. When he was in high school he started to investigate Mongolian history and Pacific Asian history. He has a dream to travel around the world and see historical places and carry on his investigation. This loan will help him to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Togtasin

texts.en:
Mr.Togtasin is bachelor degree student who studies in a local public university. He has chosen his major as history and socialism. He is very interested in this area. His dream is to influence and create a better place to live around the province where he lives, then start impacting other provinces. He is a very hard-working student. 

This loan will help Togtasin to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale depuis 2002, Ablavi sollicite son cinquiéme prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le gain tiré de cette activité lui permettra de contribuer aux dépenses de la famille. Elle est mariée à un tapissier avec 05 enfants en charge. L'ainé a 17ans et le dernier 05ans. Madame Ablavi est âgée de 37ans.
texts.en: Ablavi has been selling groceries since 2002 and is requesting her fifth loan from WAGES so she can buy goods. The profit she makes from this activity enables her to contribute to the family's expenses. She is married to a decorator and has five children in her care. The eldest is 17 years old and the youngest five. Ablavi is 37 years old.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Asiljan

texts.en: Ms. Asiljan is a student, earning her master's degree in the local public university. She has faced difficulties in paying her tuition fees. Two of her friends recommended the Kiva education loan. She is a very hardworking student. If she did not get this loan, she would have to take off for one year from university.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Chimed-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr. Chimed-Ochir is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in the Uvurhangai Province of Mongolia. His wife, Tserendegd, is 41 and helps her husband to run their organic flour retail business in a rental booth of a local market. His two children attend local schools. 

Chimed-Ochir started his organic flour retail business in the rental booth of a local market with the help of his wife in 2007. He increased his variety of products, and now he sells flour, bran (as forage for livestock), rice and sugar in his booth. His older daughter is soon to be a university student, and he and his wife are starting to save for their daughter's further education. 

He is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic flour to sell to local residents. He is a hardworking, thoughtful and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of organic flour to sell to local residents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his older children's university tuition fees and invest in the business to increase the family income.

loans.name: Kusacha De Pilcopata Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Kusacha de Pilcopata” en el centro poblado de Pilcopata en el distrito Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco. 
Eudez Bacilia tiene 31 años de edad es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene una hermosa familia, ella y su familia viven en la hermosa ciudad de Pilcopata.  

Eudez Bacilia una madre trabajadora que desde muy niña aprendió a trabajar, ella es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante con el apoyo de su pareja, ella se dedica a la venta de combustible para vehículos y en sus horas libres se  dedica a otras actividades entonces ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más combustible.   

Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de fruta, a la venta de coca, a la ganadería, al engorde de ganado, a la venta y compra de madera. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(la persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografia llego tarde a la reunion).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends have formed the communal bank “Kusacha de Pilcopata” in the town center of Pilcopata in the district of Kosñipata, which is in the Paucartambo province in the Cusco department. 

Eudez Bacilia is 31 years old and married. As a result of this beautiful relationship she has a lovely family. She and her family live in the beautiful city of Pilcopata. Eudez Bacilia is a hard-working mother who learned to work from a very early age. She is a charismatic and kind person who gets ahead with the support of her partner. She works selling fuel for vehicles and in her spare time she has other activities. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more fuel.   

This communal bank consists of several persons who are constantly looking for opportunities to move forward, and with their daily efforts they give their children a better future. The members work in agriculture, selling fruits, selling coca, raising cattle, fattening cattle, and buying and selling wood. The members are grateful for the opportunity they have been offered, and pledge to make their repayments on time. (The person in the attached photo came late to the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy more fuel

loans.name: Chuluut

texts.en:
Mr.Chuluut, 28 years old, lives with his wife and son in a small house in Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife Otgontsetseg stays home taking care of their newborn baby boy Erdenechuluun. 

Chuluut has been working at a local company as a security guard since 2011. He has purchased a secondhand hybrid car and provides taxi service during his off-duty time to increase his family income; since they have a newborn and his wife currently does not work, all the responsibility is on him. 

Chuluut is a hardworking, responsible and caring husband and father. He is now requesting a loan of 4,500,000MNT to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows to install in his small house to decrease heat loss and stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows to install in his small house to decrease heat loss and stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter

loans.name: Tsogtoo

texts.en:
Mr.Tsogtoo is 57 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife  runs a small clothing retail business in a booth located in a local market. His son is a university student in Ulaanbaatar city. 

Tsogtoo has been helping his wife run their clothing retail business since 2011. They have received a small business loan before and have a good record with the bank. They are responsible, modest and hardworking people who want their son to become well-educated. Tsogtoo is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay his son's university tuition fee and living expenses in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.use: to pay his son's university tuition fee and living expenses in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr.Ganbaatar is 27 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Narantsetseg runs a small business: a general store in a rental booth of a local market. His daughter Hulan is four and goes to local kindergarten. 

Ganbaatar helps his wife to run their family general store at the local market and also works part-time at a local construction company as an assistant worker during constructional season; he provides taxi service business during winter time. 

He is now requesting loan of MNT 3,000,000 to purchase insulation material to install in his newly built small house so his family can stay warm during winter and have a comfortable living condition. 

He is a hard-working, diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to install in his newly built small home

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Mrs.Enhjargal is 39 years old and lives with her husband and 3 daughters in a small house in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband Dashzeveg provides transportation service business in town with his truck. Her older daughter is a university student in Ulaanbaatar city, and her younger 2 daughters attend local school and kindergarten respectively.
 
Enhjargal has been working as an accountant in a local company since 2004. Her family has been living in that house for years and it needs renovation and insulation lately. She is planning to make renovations and insulation to her house before the harsh cold Mongolian winter comes. 

She is now requesting loan of 3,500,000 MNt to purchase insulation and construction materials to reduce the heat loss and stay warm during the cold winter of Mongolia. She is a hardworking and caring mother and wife.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and construction material to reduce the heat loss and stay warm during the cold winter of Mongolia.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su familia en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas y tamales.
Doña María su negocio es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, carne de pollo, res, arroz, etc. Para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y tamales de esta manera contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar.
Doña María espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento, el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia. 
Doña María espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre  2013
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working and responsible person who lives with her family in a community in the southern part of Honduras.  Her business consists of making and selling tortillas and tamales [a dish of steamed maize and other ingredients].

Maria’s business is very well known in the area, which means that there is a great demand for her product. She needs the loan to buy maize, firewood, lime powder, chicken meat, beef, rice, etc. In this way, she can continue making her tortillas and tamales, which provides a really important income for her to count on for her household. Maria hopes that, thanks to the loan, she can rely on the necessary ingredients to carry on with her business, thus meeting the demands of her customers. Similarly, she hopes that sales will increase greatly, which will mean a better quality of life for her family. She hopes that her business will continue to grow, and will become the most well-known in the community. In this way, she can carry on supporting her family, giving them better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013.

loans.use: to buy maize, firewood, lime powder, chicken meat, beef, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment to continue providing his services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables and meat products in large amounts to continue providing food delivery service to her clients

loans.name: El Mirador De Bombon Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “El Mirador de Bombon” en el distrito de Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo. 

Sebastiana tiene 48 años de edad es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella y sus hijos viven en la comunidad de Mirador de Bombon. 
 
Sebastiana es una madre trabajadora que desde muy niña aprendió de sus padres la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la ganadería, ella es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante cultivando papa, trigo, cebada y avena, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, gallinas y cuyes y también al engorde de ganado entonces ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.  
  
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la gansería, a la crianza de animales menores y el engorde de ganado. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The "El Mirador de Bombon" communal bank is made up of a group of friends and neighbours from the Challabamba district in the Paucartambo province.

Sebastiana is 48 years old and married.  From this wonderful marriage, she has two children.  Sebastiana and her children live in the Mirador do Bombon community.

Sebastiana is a hard-working mother who, from a young age, learned about agriculture from her parents.  She also learned how to raise young animals and cattle. Sebastiana is charismatic and friendly.  She is prospering as she grows potatoes, wheat,barley, and oats.  In her spare time Sebastiana raises sheep, hens, and guinea pigs.  She is also fattening up some cattle.  On this occasion Sebastiana needs a loan in order to buy seeds and manure.

This communal bank is made up of various members who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, through daily effort, to give their children a better future.  The members work in agriculture, raising geese, raising young animals, and fattening up cattle.

The members of the communal bank are grateful for this opportunity and promise to make the respective payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay part-time workers to harvest their vegetables and store in their storage pit to sell during winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase winter tires to prepare his taxi for  winter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two milk cows to use to make organic dairy products with help of his relatives.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto continua viviendo en la ciudad de Challabamba junto con su familia y con la agricultura, él sigue cultivando papa, trigo, cebada, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. 
Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La ciudad de Challabamba está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Luis Alberto still lives in Challabamba with his family. He still grows potatoes, wheat, barley, corn, and other crops. He has been farming for a number of years and believes things are going well because he works hard. 

He continues to be a member of the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata.” He now needs a loan to buy seed and fertilizer. He is grateful for and values the loan and promises to make his monthly payments on time. The city of Challabamba is in the Challabamba district in Paucartambo province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia continua viviendo con su familia en la ciudad de Challabamba, ella es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y trabajadora que continua con la venta de comida, ella sigue con el pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donde continua preparando desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Ella sigue  perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos, verduras y carnes. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Libia still lives with her family in Challabamba. She is a hardworking, determined, enterprising woman who continues to sell food. She has a small restaurant in her house where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. 

She still belongs to the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata.” She now needs a loan to buy supplies such as sacks of rice, sugar, and noodles and vegetables and meats. She is grateful for and appreciates the loan and promises to make her monthly payments on time. Mojopata is in the Challabamba district of Paucartambo province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of rice, sugar, and noodles and vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
Grimaneza continúa viviendo en la comunidad de Mojopata, ella sigue dedicándose con la venta de comida y sigue  perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo fideos, verduras, carne, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más.
 Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Grimaneza still lives in the community of Mojopata.  She still sells prepared food and belongs to the Sol Naciente de Mojopata Communal Bank.  This time, she needs a loan to buy ingredients, such as noodles, vegetables, meat, bags of rice, bags of sugar, and other things. 

She is thankful for and values the loan and she promises to make her monthly payments very responsibly.  (The community of Mojopata is located in the district of Challabamba in Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as noodles, vegetables, meat, bags of rice, bags of sugar, and other things

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana se siente contenta por el apoyo del credito pues le ayudo mucho con el negocio y le fue muy bien. Juana continua viviendo con sus hijos en la ciudad de Challabamba, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que sigue dedicandose con la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, trigo, verduras y otras cosas más.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Juana is happy with the support from the loan. It helped her a lot with her business and everything went very well. 

Juana continues to live with her children in the city of Challabamba. She is an enterprising woman who keeps working as a farmer. She has several plots of land where she grows potato, wheat, vegetables and other crops. 

She is a member of the “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” [Mojopata Rising Sun] Communal Bank and is currently asking for a loan to buy seed and fertilizer.

She appreciates and values the loan and is dedicated to pay her monthly installments responsibly.

(The Mojopata community is located in Challabamba District, Paucartambo Province in Cusco, Perú).

.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase work materials like, for example, alpaca and sheep's wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina continua viviendo en la comunidad de Mojopata y sigue se dedicandose a la venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Challabamba desde muy temprano y todos los días. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Ella continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carne, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Marcelina continues living in the community of Mojopata and continues selling food in one of the city of Challabamba’s markets starting very early every day.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She continues being a member of the “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” (Mojopata’s Rising Sun) communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy ingredients like for example: vegetables, meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and others.

She values and is grateful for the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.  (The community of Mojopata is located in Challabamba District in Paucartambo Province in Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, sacks of rice and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mariano Mercedes

texts.es:
Mariano esta feliz por el prestamo anterior y le fue muy bien por lo tanto ha incrementado el capital del negocio. 

Mariano sigue viviendo en la comunidad de Mojopata y dedicandose a la construcción de casas y en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mariano’s happy with his previous loan because he did very well and he increased his business capital.  He continues living in the community of Mojopata and working building houses.  In his free time he raises small animals like guinea pigs.  He’s been raising small animals for years now and does well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  

He belongs to the “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” (Mojopata’s Rising Sun) communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy guinea pigs.  He values and appreciates the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.  (The community of Mojopata is located in Challabamba District belonging to Paucartambo Province in Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata junto con su familia que es considerada coma una mujer trabajadora y responsable, ella alterna sus actividades económicas y con las del hogar, ella se levanta muy temprano para atender y mandar al colegio  a sus hijos, ella después se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Girasoles” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicado en distrito de la Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Dina lives in the city of Pilcopata with her family. She is considered a hard-working and responsible woman. She alternates her business activities with those of the household. She gets up very early to tend to her children and send them off to school. She then works in agriculture and raising small animals. She has already had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She belongs to the communal bank "Los Girasoles" (The Sunflowers), and at this time she needs the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. She is grateful for and values the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments with great responsibility. (The city of Pilcopata is located in the Kosñipata district in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa lives simply at Alcala with her family. She is 25 years old and blessed with three children. To make a living, she and her husband both plant and harvest corn to sell.

This couple work hard in their corn field to produce good crops. Marissa usually earns just enough income to sustain her family. This is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 25, 000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. She believes that this amount will help her in providing good nutrition to her crops. She promises to pay back her loan in full. Additional revenue will be kept as an emergency fund.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Disston Rhadi

texts.en: Disston Rhadi is 21 years old, married and has a young child. To make a living, he plants and harvests corn to sell. He is responsible for giving sustenance to his family. Disston Rhadi wanted to have continuous improvement to his corn crop production and that is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticide to use in farming. Someday he hopes to attain greater yields that would help him uplift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide to use in farming

loans.name: Ra'eda

texts.en:
Ra’eda is a 42-year-old married woman; she has five children, and four of them attend primary school. With this big family, in 2009 she thought to do something to contribute to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members. From 2009 until now, she has worked in her cosmetics shop, where she earns $541 monthly.

Her dream is to open a business with a large number of employees working in her business to give them the opportunity to work and get income. 

Ra’eda is asking Ryada for this loan to buy shelves and make some changes to her shop to attract customers. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

The person who appears in the picture is Ra’eda’s husband since she refused to appear in a picture due to cultural manners.

loans.use: to buy shelves and make other changes in the shop

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn owns and manages a small variety store within the local community. She is 34 years old and has two infant-aged children. Being a responsible mother, she aims to make her business profitable in order to supplement her husband's income. She plans to increase her product offerings but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for additional working capital of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, soap, rice, seasonings, shampoo, beverages and food snacks to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order to improve further her variety store.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, soap, rice, seasonings, shampoo, beverages and food snacks to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a 44-year-old married woman. She has owned a general store for three years. 

With her determination to keep her general store profitable and productive she is requesting for a loan of PHP 6,000 which she will use to buy grocery items such as noodles and canned goods.  This will encourage more customers to shop in her store and satisfy all of their demands. 

Fely expects that through her requested loan amount she will be able to earn a greater income which she will use for the betterment of her family.  Fely expects also to obtain a stable source of income someday. Fely hopes and believes that her requested loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries for her general store

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman is 28 years old. He works in his own workshop manufacturing aluminum frame for the windows and doors. Salman started his business recently and earns 518 USD each month. Starting his own business was an impressive step and he works hard to improve it.

Salman is requesting a youth loan from the Kiva partner to buy a Welding machine and necessary equipment that he needs. he hope that this loan will develop his business and increase his income.
Salman is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a Welding machine and necessary equipment that he needs.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en:
Primitivo is a proud farmer. He plants and harvests corn to sell. Through having this business, he is able to sustain his family’s needs. Currently, he is sending his three children to school.

Primitivo hopes to continue sustaining his crops with necessary farm inputs. However, due to insufficient funds, he is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming. He will keep trying his best to become a successful farmer for the welfare of his family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Jomelyn

texts.en: To improve her variety store, Jomelyn is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of food snacks, canned goods, noodles, assorted candies, soaps, beverages, and seasonings to sell in the local community. She is 38 years old and has three school-age children. Despite being a widow, she has this strong determination in improving her status of living and also to support her children's education for them to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food snacks, canned goods, noodles, assorted candies, soaps, beverages, and seasonings to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase office equipment, including a computer and scanner.

loans.name: Fathi

texts.en:
Fathi is 58 years old; he lives with his wife and his child in Gaza. He has been selling clothes since 2004. He works hard to support his family to provide good living conditions for them.

Fathi asking Ryada for this loan to buy a display box and models for display. This will help him to display the clothes for the clients properly, and give a good look to his shop.

Fathi is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a display box and models for display

loans.name: Miden

texts.en:
Miden is 27 years old, married and living at Alcala with her spouse and child. They couple are both farmers within their village. They plant and harvest corn and vegetables to sell. Miden wants to maintain good growth of her corn crops, and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy pesticides and herbicides used in farming. She believes that through application of essential pesticides to her farmland, she could further control the pests affecting the growth of her crop. 

According to Miden, she will also pay laborers who help them in their cornfield. She hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn better income for education expenses and to provide her family with a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and herbicides used in farming and pay labor costs, too.

loans.name: Santos Sr.

texts.en:
Santos is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 (Philippine pesos). He is a farmer, 36 years old, married and a father of five. He cultivates a one-hectare plot of farmland, where he plants and harvests rice. He will use the said loan for his farming needs, like buying fertilizers, seed varieties, and pesticides, and for paying farm labor costs. 

He has been 20 years doing this farming activity, and he dedicates his best effort in the business to his family’s welfare. According to Santos, he has a net profit of PHP 20,000 every harvest, and this was used for the repayment of his children’s tuition fees and school allowances. 

Also, one of his projects where some of his net income goes is the gradual construction of their house. He believes that having this simple, yet happy life is a blessing from God.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seed varieties, and pesticides, and for paying farm labor costs.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is a married, 49, and a father of two. His family is peacefully living in the province of Isabela. His other child is disabled. According to him, it is God's plan that he must be more responsible and a patient father to his child, with or without a disability. 

He is a tenant farmer and he is cultivating 2.5 hectares of farm land. He has been doing this for eight years. He plants and harvests rice, and he said that his net profit for every cropping season was PHP 50,000. Ramon also shared that most of his profits in farming are being used in paying his loan and for other expenditures, like allowances, tuition fees of his child, and the basic needs of the family. 

However, he wants to earn as much as he can above his current net profit, and to do this, he is wishing for a loan of PHP 35,000. This will allow him to have additional capital and he can buy agricultural supplies like pesticides, rice seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like pesticides, rice seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mahmmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 25 years old; he lives in Ramallah with his family, only one of whom is employed and helping him provide for the family.

In the first of May 2010, Mahmoud opened his own barbershop and recently he hired an employee to help him.  Because his customer base is increesing he is very well known now.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a barber chair and to add decoration for his shop.  This will increase the number of clients and increase his income, which will help him improve the financial condition of his family.  

Mahmmoud is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a barber chair and decorate his shop.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia is 22 years old, and she lives in Tulkrem with her husband and two children. In 2010, she decided to open her own shop; she has more than three years of experience in the sales field. She sells plastic materials for home use like bowls and other things. The neighbors really like her treatment and also prefer to buy things from her. 

Shadia is asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy new materials and make new decorations for her shop. Her dream is to see her business expand. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success. 

The person who appears in the picture is Shadia’s husband since she declined to appear in the picture for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy new materials and make new decorations for her shop.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda wishes to have a continuous, smooth flow of her retail store. In this way, she could generate higher profits and re-stock her retail store.

At this time, Luzviminda is in need of additional capital to satisfy her costumer's demand. 

So, Luzviminda is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase groceries such as biscuits and noodles.

She knows that through completeness of grocery items offered, she will be able to secure her family's future and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as biscuits and noodles to re-stock her retail store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 51 years old, married, and blessed with three children.She cooks and sells peanut butter to her village.

Rosemarie has been in the business for over six years and has been very patient in waiting to acquire income from her small business. Now, she wants to keep her business profitable and improve the taste of her peanut butter. Due to insufficient funds, she has decided to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 11, 000, which allows her to buy peanuts and sugar, as well as plastic bottles used in packaging the peanut butter to sell.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, sugar, and plastic bottles used in packaging peanut butter to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Rice farming is Emma's primary activity, and she's been in this business for almost 23 years. Her net income from the last harvest was 35,000 PHP. Due to a lack of capital, she would like to receive a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm. Her profits help a lot to cover her family's daily expenditures. She hopes that her loan will be granted so that she can improve and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Mely Rose

texts.en:
Mely Rose is 47 years old and blessed with five children. She engaged herself in livestock business. She has been in this kind of business for seven years. She is happy because having this kind of business has been of great contribution to her family's living condition. 

Now, she wants to develop her business. That's the reason why she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to buy chicks, ducklings, vitamins, and feeds. She hopes to obtain a higher income in order to uplift their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chicks, ducklings, vitamins, and feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Clarivel

texts.en: Agricultural farming is Clarivel's business. She's been in this business for almost 23 years. At the last cropping, she earned a net income of 30,000 PHP. Her profits were a great help for her family, spent primarily on their daily expenses and school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient funds she would like a loan of 35,000 PHP to pay for the land preparation of her farm. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her farming business.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation of her farm

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business of Lucila. She's been in this business for almost 15 years, and has earned a net income in last cropping amounting to PHP 15,000.

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to avail a loan from those generous lenders amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can earn more profits to benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland has been in the agriculture business for almost fifteen years and earns a net income of 20,000 PHP. His profits from his farming business are used toward their daily allowances and school fees for his children. Due to a lack of capital, Roland would like a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase insecticides, fertilizers, and seedlings for his farm. He's hoping that his rice fields will continue to grow and he will earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides, fertilizers, and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is a 51 years old, married person. He has six children and two of his children have graduated from college. They live in the village of Rizal. He manages planting and harvesting rice on  a 1.2 hectare piece of farmland. He has been involved in farming for 35 years. According to Rudy, the amount of his harvest is good. He is earning PHP 20,000 net income every cropping season. His earnings are usually used in paying the tuition fees and school allowances of his children and the family's daily expenditures. 

Rudy wishes to borrow PHP30,000 as additional capital to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers and pesticides. He will also use a part of the loan for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, like fertilizers and pesticides. He will also use some part of the loan for his children's education.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 53 years old, married, and had three children. He plants and harvests rice crop to sell. Through this kind of business, he was able to sustain his family needs. According to him, he earns about PHP 20,000 each crop season, which is twice a year; some of it is used for the maintenance of his crops and some goes for meals and bills at home. 

Alfredo wanted to ensure good crop production, but he had insufficient funds to sustain his crop. With regards to this matter, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy four bags of rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to be used in farming. 

He hopes that lenders will approve his requested loan so he can obtain greater income and improve his way of living.

loans.use: to buy four bags of rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to be used in farming.

loans.name: Sayna

texts.en: For the last 14 years, Sayna has earned a living by farming rice. She made PHP 25,000 on her last crop and uses her earnings to pay daily expenses and school fees. She is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seedlings. She's hoping that this loan will allow her to improve her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seedlings.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.en:
Rice farming is the primary activity of Fidencio. He has been in this business for almost twenty years. Fidencio earned a net income of PHP 35,000 last cropping. He wanted to avail a loan due to insufficient funds in his agricultural business. He requested a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase  fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. 

His profits in the farming business are usually spent on school allowances for his children. He's hoping that his crop will grow fruitfully so that he can earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 41 years old, married to Roger and had two children. According to her, her retail store is open from 6 o'clock in the morning until 6 o'clock in the evening. Catherine sells grocery items to the people in her village and is able to earn about PHP 15,000 monthly. She uses the income for the education expenses of her children and revolving capital for continuous operation of her business.

She joined ASKI because she wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 30,000 to have additional capital to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs, breads, and soft drinks to sell in her store. Catherine hopes to become a successful entrepreneur someday so she can keep attaining a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs, breads, and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou has been engaged in a direct selling business for how many years. Due to insufficient profit, Marilou decided to rent a stall in the market and there she operates her clothing sales business. She wishes to encourage more customers and to have greater income to sustain her daily basic needs. With this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more clothes of different types to sell. She is hoping that her requested amount of loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy more clothes of different types to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Loreta

texts.en: Hog raising is the primary activity of Ma. Loreta. She has been in this business for almost three years and earns an income of PHP 3,000 per hog. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to purchase hogs and hog feed. Her previous profits have been of great help to her family because they spent them on their daily expenditures. Ma. Loreta is hoping that her business will continue to grow and improve.

loans.use: To purchase hogs and hog feed

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo, 34, is married with three children who attend school. He raises hogs and wants to ensure they receive good nutrition. He is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy hog feed, rice bran and medicine for his hogs. He believes that this will keep his hogs healthier and reach their optimum growth. Rodrigo will then be able to sell them at a higher price.

Rodrigo also wants to continue his quail-raising business as added income. Someday, he hopes to earn a better income from his businesses so he can continue to send his children to school and be able to give his family a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice bran and medicine to improve the nutrition of his hogs.

loans.name: Jeanalyn

texts.en: Despite the hardships of living, Jeanalyn has this determination to uplift her status of living. She is 30 years old and has one child attending school. She aims to improve her variety store in order to increase her income. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of food snacks, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, eggs, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. Through this loan, she believes that she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, eggs, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon is 43 years old, married to Beatrice, and blessed with four children. He is into brick-making at Kamobo, at the outskirts of Kapsabet town. He gets a monthly income of KES 80,000 from this business. 

He has borrowed a loan of KES 100,000, which he will use to expand his business by increasing the labor force. With the anticipated profits, he will pay school fees for his children and repay his loan.

loans.use: to expand his business by increasing the labor force.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 48 years old, lives in Sta. Filomena Dipolog city. She is gifted with three children.

Amelia is a breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardship, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself planting vegetables and other variety of agricultural commodities.

In need of additional working capital, Amelia decide to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already, and requested PHP 50,000 for buying goods and spices.

Being an MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. 

Amelia is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all, nor would she have been guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a truck someday to use for her daily activity.

loans.use: to pay for spices for her spices stand.

loans.name: Reginalda

texts.en:
Reginalda is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has six children. Reginalda has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Reginalda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and to pay for the labor in planting season. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus increasing her yield and profit. In the future, Reginalda hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and to pay for the labor in planting season.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 28 years old and lives in Sebac, Tudela, Philippines. She is married, with one child. Joan is a private teacher and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional housing materials such as cement, corrugated bars, plywood, common nails, plain sheets, sand, gravel, etc. Joan has been a member of PMPC for 10 months. In the future,Joan hopes to save for future consumption. best puzzle games at thepcaa

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials, such as cement, corrugated bars, plywood, nails, plain sheets, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old from Nyahururu. She is not married yet, but she is blessed with two children, aged 8 and 4 years.

She is a charcoal dealer, a business she has been running for the past three years.  She has applied for her second loan of KES 10,000 from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy 20 bags of charcoals, each at KES 500.  Her monthly income right now from her business is KES 15,000. 

She intends to use profits from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay back her loan to Kadet Ltd.

In the future, Grace hopes to start selling cereals for more profits.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 39 years old and married, and she lives at Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale of the pigs, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement.

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs of her own, as well. Through Pauglam she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy piglets and feeds. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, augmenting the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage, which would enable her to keep sanitary conditions more easily.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Patterson

texts.en:
Patterson is 40 years old and from Olkalou. He is married to Martha, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with three children, ages 11, 9, and 5 years old.

He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last six years. He would like to buy a dairy cow, and to enable him do that, he has applied for his fifth loan of KES 50,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now from the sale of farm produce like potatoes, cabbages, kale, maize, and green beans is KES 15,000. He intends to use profits from his expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes for his future business is to be successful in dairy farming and to have a healthy family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Rustica

texts.en:
Rustica is a farmer from the town of CPG, Bohol. She is married and the mother of three grown children. 

Rustica has been in the rice-farming business for more than 20 years now. She also operates a sari-sari (or variety) store business, selling goods like rice, noodles, canned goods, soap, and toiletries among others.  The two are the sources of her income.

Rustica is asking a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Romualdo

texts.en:
Romualdo is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and has four children. Romualdo has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income.
Romualdo is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, he will be able to go back to fishing and augment his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Romualdo hopes of making his business a success and sustainable. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 22 years old and single, and she supports one member of her family.

She operates a retail shop in Kapkechui at the outskirts of Kapsabet town and is served by Kadet Kapsabet Branch. She has been in this business for the past two years.  She generates a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She has borrowed KES 20,000, which she will use to purchase wheat floor, maize flour, tea leaves, and eggs as additional stock for her shop. 

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and make loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hyline is 23 years and single, and she supports three members of her family.

She runs a milk bar in Chemundu Location at the outskirts of Kapsabet town.  She is served by Kadet Ltd, Kapsabet office. She has been in the business for the past four years; she  gets an average monthly income of KES 6,000.

She plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 10,000 to purchase more milk for resale. 

She will use the profits from the milk business to educate her siblings and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more milk for her milk bar

loans.name: Lampeshua

texts.en:
Lampeshua is 45 years old, married, and has 10 children, four of whom attend school. She is from Nakuru. She is a farmer who grows maize, potatoes, beans, and wheat. She also rears livestock such as cows and goats. Her monthly income from the sale of farm produce is 15,000 KES.

Lampeshua is requesting her third loan from KADET for 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and maize planting seeds..She intends to use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer and to have a healthy family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and maize seeds

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 25 years old, a female and married. She has one (1) child who is 2 years old whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer.

Pauline has a tailoring shop which has lasted for three years now. It is located in Malindi. In her business, she earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. She is taking her first loan of KES 10,000 which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying material, zippers, sewing threads and canvas.

Pauline will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to expand her tailoring shop and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy material, zippers, sewing threads and canvas to make clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola is 25 years old and married. She has three children, 9, 7 and 3 years old, whom she supports. 

Pola runs a grocery business, which has lasted for five years now.  It is located at Mpirani. She earns a monthly income of KES.5,800. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer.

She is taking a second loan from Kadet of KES15,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks of maize, beans, coconut, and rice. Her previous loan of KES 10,000 she paid back to KADET successfully. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by making it a wholesale grocery business. Her  hopes and dreams for her future business are to open another grocery business and also to make sure her children get better education and have a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, coconut, and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Renson

texts.en:
Renson is 39 years old, a male and married. He has five children 11, 9, 7, 5 and 3 years old whom he supports. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET officer and he is a farmer and has been farming for three years now. In his business he earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. He is taking his third loan of KES 30,000, which he intends to use by buying farm inputs, chemicals, fertilizer and ploughing. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was paid back successfully. 

Renson will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to expand his farming and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, chemicals, fertilizer and ploughing for his farming.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old and from Sakutiek, which is in the outskirts of Naivasha town, and is married; they have been blessed with one child who is in kindergarten.

Elizabeth is a farmer and has been in it for many years. She has applied for her first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on her farm. She is optimistic that her farm will do better after the loan.

She hopes to expand her farm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on the farm

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 30 years, married, and has two children who attend school. He operates a bakery, which he has been doing for seven years. 

Harrison is requesting a loan from KADET, which he will use to buy modern baking equipment. In the future, he hopes to expand his business to a large scale confectionery business so as to boost his income and create employment opportunities for others.

loans.use: to purchase modern baking equipment

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 28 years old. She is married and supports three members of her family. Her spouse, Wicliffe, helps in providing additional income for the family. She runs a retail business in Icyandwa, a location served by KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last ten years. She gets an average monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She plans to use the amount borrowed of 50,000 KES to purchase additional stock of wheat flour, rice and sugar. Her dream is to educate her kids and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of wheat flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 47 years old and from Olkalou. She is the single mother of two young adults, ages 25 and 23 years old.

She is a farmer who practices mixed farming, a business that she has been running for the past 15 years. She grows crops like wheat, potatoes and cabbages.  

To enable her to buy some herbicides and fertilizer to spray these crops for maximum yields, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Julia's monthly income right now is KES 10,000.  She hopes to use profits from her expanded business to pay her loan back to Kadet Ltd.

Her hopes for her future business are for it to excel and for her family to be prosperous.

loans.use: To buy herbicides and fertilizer to spray her crops

loans.name: Jira

texts.en:
Jira is 26 years old, a male and married. He has one (1) child, who is one month old whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer.

Jira works as a bodaboda (motorbike driver). He has been in this business for three years based in Malindi. In his business, he earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

Jira is taking his first loan of KES 15,000 which he intends to use to repair, service and maintain his motorbike. Jira will use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike. His hopes and dreams for his future business is to have a bright future.

loans.use: to repair, service and maintain his motorbike.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is 25 years old and from Sakutie.  He is married, and he and his wife are blessed with one child.

Harun has a pharmacy that he has been running for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy more medicine to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to open another branch of his pharmacy in a neighboring town.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to add to his stock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and does farming in Kangundo town. She keeps livestock and grows cash crops such as maize and vegetables for selling. She is married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. Her spouse produces additional income in support of the family.

Mary plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds for planting. She also plans to buy feed for her cattle. This is her second loan and she repaid her previous loan successfully.

Mary hopes to have more cattle as well as educate her children to tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena has a retail shop that she has been running for the last 6 years. She is 41 years old, married and together with her spouse (who also produces income), they are blessed with 3 children. 

This being her second loan term, she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of retail goods for selling. These include sugar, cooking oil, flour and rice. She anticipates making more profits with which she will increase her stock as well as repay the loan.

In future, Magdalena hopes to open a wholesale shop, install electricity in her home, and educate her children to college level.

loans.use: To buy more stock of retail goods to sell

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 45 years old from Naivasha and is married; they are blessed with two children.
