Rahab does a charcoal business that she has been doing for the past one year. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her buy more charcoal to add to her stock. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan.

She hopes to add more rental houses, which is her secondary business, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to add to her stock.

loans.name: Kinyua

texts.en:
Kinyua is a 39-year-old married male. He has three children, ages 12, 8 and 5 years old respectively, all of whom he supports. He was introduced to Kadet Ltd. by a Kadet officer, and he has a retail shop. He has been in this business for six years, which is located at Marereni . 

In his business, he earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. He is taking his third loan of KES 40,000, which he intends to use in adding stocks to his business by buying wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, salt, rice, and cooking oil. His previous loan of KES 30,000 was paid back successfully. Kinyua will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by making it to be a wholesale shop. 

His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to grow his business and live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, salt, rice, and cooking oil to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a farmer in Makueni town where she plants cash crops such as maize, vegetables and fruit. She also keeps livestock. She is 57 years old, married to Phillip, and they have been blessed with two grown-up children who are now independent. Christine has been in the farming business for five years and earns a monthly income of 10,500 Kenyan shillings. 

This is her 5th loan and she will use the amount to buy farm inputs for use in her farm. These include seeds and pesticides. She will also use part of the loan for pruning expenses. She will use the anticipated profits to install electricity in her house. 

In future Christine hopes to be financially independent and able to cater for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and pesticides as well as for pruning expenses

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is 46 years old and married. He supports six members of his family. His spouse sells vegetables. He operates a motorcycle transport business in Kamobo, which he has been doing for one year. He earns an average monthly income of 6,000 KES.

Job is requesting a loan from KADET for 30,000 KES, which he will use to purchase a new motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and repay his loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert  is 33 years old and married to Eunice.  Together they are blessed with two children, ages 10 years and one year. 

He has a tea-hawking business in Chemundu location and is served by Kadet Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the past three years, and from this business he gets a monthly income of KES.10,000.

He has borrowed KES 20,000 that he will use to purchase more tea leaves for resale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to make loan repayments and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 38 years old and comes from Nakuru; he is married to Rebecca and they are blessed with three children aged 10, 8 and 6 years old.

He is a milk vendor, a business he has been running for the past twelve years . To enable him to increase the number of customers that he supplies milk to, he has applied for his third loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd which will be used to buy more litres of milk from the main suppliers.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 10,000 and he intends to use profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay his loan back to Kadet Ltd.

He hopes for a bright future both for his business and for his family.

loans.use: To buy milk for vending  in large quantities

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 41 years old, a male and married. He has four children 16, 10, 6 and 4 years old whom he supports. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET officer. He is a farmer and has been farming for five years now. In his business he earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. He is taking his second loan of KES 30,000, with which he intends to buy farm inputs, chemicals, fertilizer and ploughing. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was paid back successfully. 

Dickson will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to expand his farming, educate his children and live a better life.

loans.use: To purhase farm inputs, chemicals, fertilizer and ploughing.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 38 years old from Naivasha and is married; the two have been blessed with four children who are in school.

Eliud has a retail shop that he has been running for the past five years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more carpet, plastic chairs and mattresses.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs, carpet and mattresses.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 40 years old and from Nyandarua South.  He is married, and he and his wife have been blessed with four children.

Samuel is a farmer, and he has farmed for the past 5 years. He has applied for his second loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy fertilizer and seedlings to use on his farm. He will also use part of the money to pay for labor.

He hopes to be able to build a house for his family in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings and pay for labor.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is 32 years old and is married with a child who is eight years old.

Caleb is a carpenter and has been in this business for many years. He has applied for his fourth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy more timber to use in his workshop. He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is progressing well with his business.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 50,000. He would like to use the loan to buy additional stock for his business, like sugar and cooking fat. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and to repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 55 years old and from Nyahururu. He is married to Elizabeth, who is a housewife, and they are blessed with four children, ages 21, 15, 10, and 7 years.

He is a butcher, a business that he has been running for the past ten years.   He has applied for his third loan of KES 20,000 from Kadet Ltd. to buy some goats for slaughter so as to sell their meat to his customers at the butcher shop, 

His monthly income right now is KES 120,000.  He intends to use profits expected from his expanded business to repay his loan to Kadet Ltd and to educate some of his children, who are still schooling.

Samuel hopes for a prosperous future for his business and his family.

loans.use: To buy goats for slaughter

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 39 years old and from Nyandarua South.  He is married, and he and his wife  have three children between 12 years and 3 years old.

Isaac is a farmer, and he has been farming for many years. He has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy another dairy cow to add to his livestock. This will in turn increase his milk productivity, as well as increase his income

He hopes to expand his business further in the near future

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a lady of twenty nine years, married, and a mother of three children. She sells second-hand shoes, new shoes, and hand bags in Kiambaa in the outskirts of Limuru town. Ann has been in this business for eight years now, getting a monthly income of KES 6,300.

This will be Ann's first loan with KADET Ltd. and she plans to use the entire loan to buy shoes and hand bags for resale. In future, she wants to buy a plot, educate her children, and raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 29 years old, married and supports three members of her family. Her spouse helps in producing additional income for the family, too. 

Gladys runs a retail business in the Siaya location and is served by KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last two years. She gets an average monthly income of Kshs. 3,000 (Kenyan shillings) from her business. 

She plans to use the amount borrowed of Ksh. 30,000 to buy additional stock of soap, cooking fat and rice. Her dream is to expand her business into a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soap, cooking fat and rice.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is progressing well in his business. He has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000. He would like to use the loan to buy flour, sugar, and cooking fat. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 30 years old and from Nakuru. She is married to Patrick, and they are blessed with two children, aged 10 and 7 years old.

She is a tailor, a business she has been operating for the last seven years. To enable her to buy clothing materials and sewing thread for use in making clothes for her customers, she has applied for her first loan of Kshs. 20,000 (Kenyan shillings) from KADET Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is Kshs. 7,000, and she intends to use profits from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay back her loan to KADET Ltd.

In the future, she hopes to be an established tailor in her town.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and sewing thread to use in making clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Saidimu

texts.en:
Saidimu is 51 years old and from Naivasha. He is married, and has been blessed with seven children.

Saidimu does a farming business that he has been running for over 30 years now. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy some seedlings and fertilizers to use on his farm. He is optimistic that his farm will do better after the loan.

He hopes to be the top farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kasaine

texts.en:
From Sakutiek, Kasaine is 25 years old, married, and the father of three children who are in school. A farmer for many years, Kasaine has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on his farm.  He looks forward to having a bumper harvest after the loan.

Kasaine hopes to grow his farm in the near future and employ more people to help him.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a very hardworking man from Olkalou. He is 46 years old, married to Naomi who is a farmer, and blessed with six children aged 20, 18, 15, 13, 10 and 8 years old.

He is a farmer who practices mixed farming, an occupation he has been carrying out for the last three years. Samuel has applied for his fifth loan of KSHS 70,000 from Kadet Ltd to buy two donkeys and a cart to assist him in transporting milk and other baggage to the market at a fee. 

His monthly income right now is KSHS 30,000 and he intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan back to KADET LTD and to educate his children.

He has dreams and hopes of buying a lorry for transporting milk.

loans.use: To buy two donkeys and a cart for his transportation business

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 25 years and is married to Faith and together they are blessed with three children ages 6 years and 4 years (the four year olds are twins). 

He runs a retail shop in Chepkumia in the outskirts of Kapsabet town.  This has been his income generator for the last one year.

Wycliffe plans to use the amount borrowed, of Kshs 80,000 to purchase motorcycle brakes, exhausts, power commanders and motor cycle controls. 

He will use the profits from his shop to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more motorcycle stock for the business.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnabas is 50 years old and is married to Elizabeth. He supports five members of his family. Barnabas runs a milk retail business in Chemundu at the outskirts of Kapsabet town and is served by Kadet Kapsabet Branch.

He has been in this business for the last four years, from this business he get a monthly income of Kshs. 15,000. He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 20,000 of which he will use purchase milk and pay transport charges to the market. Barnaba will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and also expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase milk and pay transport charges to the market

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 37 years old and married to Veronica.  He supports four members of his family.  He  runs a mechanic and dairy farming business in Chemundu  location at the outskirts of Kapsabet town.

He has been in these businesses for the last three years and he gets a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000.  He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 100,000, of which he will use to purchase rolling jacks, pliers, spanners and an air compressor.  

Eliud will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and improve his dairy cows for better production.

loans.use: Eliud will use this loan to purchase additional  equipment for the business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 51 years old  and married to Pamela. He supports four members of his family.  He is into dairy farming in Kipture located at the outskirts of Kapsabet town. 

He has been in this business for the last twenty years and from this business he gets a monthly income of Kshs. 40,000.  He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 70,000 to pay school fees.

He will use the profits from the dairy business to repay the loan and expand his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia, 23 years old, is from Nakuru. She is married to Fredrick who produces some additional income for the family and they are blessed with two children aged 7 and 5 years old.

She is in the business of offering computer and printing services. To buy printing papers, binding spirals, toners and cartridges, she has applied for her first loan of KSHS 20,000 from KADET LTD.

Julia has been in this business for the last seven years and her monthly income right now is 15,000 KSHS. She intends to use the profits from her expanded business to open another business. 
 
She hopes is to own a chain of stationery shops in the future.

loans.use: To buy printing paper, spiral bindings,  toners and catridges

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 28 years old. He is married to Beatrice, and together they are blessed with two children. Geoffrey resells household items like blankets, glasses, carpets, etc. He has been in this business for 11 years now and gets a monthly income of 17,000 shillings.

This will be Geoffrey's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy stock of blankets, carpet, thermos and other items in bulk for reselling during this season. 

Geoffrey desires to educate his children in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of blankets, carpet, thermos and other items in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old and married to Shadrack.  They support a family of seven members. 

She is a mixed farmer who has been in the business for the past ten years, with a current monthly income of KES 10,000.

Alice is currently servicing her fourth loan from KADET of KES 60,000.  It will help her to prepare her land and buy planting seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. 

Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family

loans.use: to prepare her land and buy planting seedlings

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has a retail shop in Kangundo town where she sells household goods. She has been in the business for 14 years and she makes a monthly income of 50,000 Kes. Lucy is 37 years old and married to Antony, who also provides income.  They have been blessed with two children.

Lucy plans to use the loan amount to buy household goods such as water basin and buckets, plates, cooking pans and spoons for resale. She anticipates to make more profit which will be used to provide for the family's needs.

This is her fourth loan term and she paid all her previous loans successfully.  In the future Lucy hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty two years old, married to Moses and the mother of three children.  She is a crop farmer in Kiambaa, in the outskirt of Limuru,   Mary has been in this business for seven years and she gets a monthly income of five thousand one hundred.

This will be Mary's first loan with Kadet Ltd.  She plans to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.  In the future Mary wishes to educate her children and grow more to becoming a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedling.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a young single man of 21 years; he supports his parents. He sells fruit in Kangemi, and has been in this business for two years. Edward gets a monthly income of 12,000 shillings.

This will be Edward's first loan with KADET LTD; he plans to use the entire loan to buy fruit in bulk. 

In the future, he wants to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a newly married gentleman who also supports his two brothers. He operates a motorcycle transport business, while his wife is a tailor. John learnt about KADET from some of his colleagues in town who are registered members of KADET Ltd.

John has been advanced with a first loan of KES 30,000 (Kenyan shillings), which will help him to purchase household assets. The proceeds from their business will be used to repay the loan and cater to their basic needs, as well as expand.

He hopes to see that his younger brothers achieve higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to purchase household assets.

loans.name: Olchinka

texts.en:
Olchinka is 46 years old and a father of four children aged between fourteen and five years old. He is a livestock trader and has been running the business for the past ten years making a monthly income of KES 45,000.

He has borrowed a third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost the business. His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for trade

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 57 years old and married to Tina.  They are blessed with six children, ages between 26 and 7 years, whom they both support. 

Ernest runs a retail shop in Kapkangani at the outskirts of Kapsabet town. He has been in this business for the past five years. From this business he gets a monthly income of KES 50,000. 

He has borrowed KES 55,000 to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice, and cooking fat for his shop. 

He will use the anticipated profits to increase his business stock, make some savings, and make his loan repayment. 

His dream is to give the best to his family, i.e., meeting its financial needs; give the best education to his children, and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice, and cooking fat for his shop

loans.name: Nahum

texts.en: Nahum is 29 years old, married and the mother of two children who are 2 and 4 years old. She earns a living by running a boutique in Kapsabet town. She has been in this business for the last four years and earns a monthly income of Kshs. 12,000.  She is requesting a loan for Kshs 100,000 to buy new clothes, including shoes and sandals, to sell to her customers. With the profits she expects to earn from this loan, she will expand her business, set aside some savings, and make loan payments. Her dream is to give her family a good life — i.e., meet their financial needs and give the best possible education to her children. Her future goal for her business is to open branches in nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 23 year old lad who is employed in the motorcycle transport business.  He supports his two siblings.  

Bernard learned about Kadet from another motorcyclist in town who was already being funded by Kadet ltd.

Bernard has acquired his first loan of kes 91,020 to acquire his own motorcycle. He is likely to earn more money due to his flexibility and his established customer base.

He will use the proceeds to support his siblings' schooling. His dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 50 years of age and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children. She runs a green grocery shop.  Millicent has been in this business for four years and it has been profitable. 

This is her third loan term and she intends to buy onions for resale. This will enable her to have enough stock and thereby meet the demands of her customers.  Millicent will use the anticipated profits to expand her business by buying more stock.

Millicent hopes to become an onion wholesaler, make more income and provide her family with the basic needs.

loans.use: to buy onions for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a lady of thirty years, married to Patrick, and mother of three children. She sells groceries in Muguga in the outskirt of Kangemi. Recently, she started dairy farming. She has been in the grocery business for four years now and gets monthly income of 12,000 KES.

This will be Mary's third loan with Kadet Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. In future, she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single lady of 41 years.  She has two children. 

She does pig farming, and she has been in this business for four years now. Jane gets monthly income of KES 50,000.

This will be Jane's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy piglets.

In the future she wants to educate her children and become a prosperous business woman.

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old and married to Rose.  He is the father of two children., he operates taxi business in Kangemi, and he has been in this business for five years now. He gets monthly income of KES 40,000.

This will be Joseph's fifth loan with KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy four tires for the taxi and also to take the taxi in for servicing. 

In future he wants to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his taxi and service it

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 39 years old and from Nakuru. She is not married, but has two children aged 20 and 3 years.

She operates a butcher shop, which has been running for the last four years. To enable her to buy more goats for slaughter, she has applied for her third loan of Kshs. 80,000 (Kenyan shillings) from KADET Ltd.

Right now her monthly income is Kshs. 30,000. Her intention is to use profits from her expanded business to start another business and to pay back her loan to KADET Ltd.

Milka hopes and dreams of a very successful and fulfilled future.

loans.use: to buy more goats to be slaughtered.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 30 years old, married to Jackson and supporting a family of seven. Her children are aged between thirteen and two. She is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last five years with a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is currently servicing her fifth loan of KES 70,000 from KADET, and this will facilitate her in preparation of the farm and purchase of inputs. Grace hopes to use anticipated profits to expand her farm and reinvest. Her dream is to improve the family's living standards by educating her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to manage her wheat farm

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 49 years old and married to Catherine.  They are blessed with three children, ages between 15 and 21 years. 

He runs a mobile money-transfer shop as well as a dairy farming business in Kilibwoni location, and he is served by Kadet Kapsabet Branch.

Edward has been in these businesses for the past four years, and he earns a monthly income of KES 110,000.

Edward has now ventured into another type of business, where he would offer photocopying services in his money-transfer shop.   He has borrowed KES 50,000 to use to purchase a photocopying machine.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to pay his children's school fees, repay his loan, and improve his dairy cows for better production.

His dream is to give the best to his family as the bread winner, as well as to expand his businesses to a point of becoming financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a photocopying machine

loans.name: Olokukua

texts.en: Olokukua is 48 years old, married to Nyambura, and supports a family of eleven. For the last five years, he has been farming wheat on his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.He learned about KADET LTD through posters. This will be his fifth loan after successfully paying off the previous ones. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat. His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children as well as put up a permanent home. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to manage his wheat farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 59-year-old retail-shop proprietor in Voi Kenya. She is a married mother who supports four grown-ups, and her spouse provides additional income. She has been in this business for the past three years and has done great.

This marks her third borrowing from KADET Ltd, to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase more shop stock of maize and wheat flour,  rice, cooking oil, sugar, and washing detergents. 

The anticipated profit will go to service her loan and to educate her children in college. She hopes to see her business stable and pass it on to her children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize and wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar, and washing detergents

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 43 years old, is from Nakuru. He is married to Beatrice who is a dairy farmer and they are blessed with four children aged 11, 9, 6 and 2 years old.

Joseph is a pharmacist, a business he has been operating for the last 10 years. To enable him to add more medicine to sell to his customers, he has applied for his second loan of KSHS 40,000 from KADET Ltd.

His monthly income right now is KSHS 18,000 and he plans to use the profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to expand his business even further.

He hopes for a successful and a blessed future both for his business and family

loans.use: To buy medicine in bulk for his pharmacy

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is applying four his fourth business loan, which he will use to purchase spare motorbike parts, in addition to the bicycle parts business which he has always run. He hopes to grow both business and eventually own a workshop for assembling motor bicycles.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorbike parts.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 26 years old from Nyahururu. He is married to Anne, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with two children aged 3 years and 4 months.

He has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years. He grows crops like maize, kale, potatoes, and cabbage. Francis would like to expand his farming activities by livestock keeping. To enable him to buy ten lambs for rearing, he has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES (Kenya Shillings)  from Kadet Ltd.

Right now his monthly income from his business is 20,000 KES and he intends to use profits from his expanded business to buy a dairy cow. His dreams and hopes for the future are to be a prominent farmer in his region and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To buy ten lambs  for rearing

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 46 years old from Naivasha. She is married and blessed with one child who is in school. Irene has a hotel business that she has been running for the past 6 years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her buy tables and chairs for her hotel. She hopes to open another hotel in the near future.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her hotel

loans.name: David

texts.en:
This marks David's fourth loan to finance his business. He has opened a second clothing shop dealing in assorted children's clothing. The money borrowed will help him stock his shop, given the festive season is approaching.
He hopes to have a good catch on sales and expand to other towns as well in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses, and trousers.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 40 years old and is from Naivasha. She is married and she and her spouse have two children who are in school.

Hannah has a clothing business that she has been running for the past year. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock. She is optimistic that her business will do well after the loan.

She hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and add to her stock to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 45 years old and from Nakuru, Kenya. She is not married but is blessed with four children aged 28, 25, 13 and 9 years old.

For 22 years she has run a business selling fruits and vegetables. To enable her buy more stocks of capsicum (bell peppers), gourgettes (zucchini), onions, tomatoes, oranges, bananas, mangoes and carrots to sell to her customers, she has applied for her third loan of 60,000 KES from Kadet Ltd., Kiva's field partner

Salome's monthly income right now is 30,000 KES and she intends to use profits from her expanded business to pay back her loan and to educate two of her children whom are still in school.

Her hope and dream is for both her business and family to be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fernard

texts.en:
Fernard is 31 years old and married to Agnes. Together they are blessed with two children who are in school.

He has a retail shop in Naivasha, which he has been running for four years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to pay for labor and to buy inventory such as sugar, rice, and flour. He intends to use anticipated profit from the expanded business to cater to his family's needs.

In the near future, he hopes to grow his business financially to a greater level.

loans.use: To pay for labor and to buy sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 52 years old and married, with six children who are in school.

Simon is a farmer and he has been in it for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

He hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertlizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 28-year-old beauty products retailer in Bombolulu- Kisimani, Mombasa. She is a married woman who is expecting her first child. She has been in this business for the last four years with support from her spouse.

This marks Sally's third loan from KADET Ltd to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase hair oil, hair braids, shampoo and plastic chairs for her new salon. With her anticipated profit, she plans to service her loan and purchase additional items for her salon. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil, hair braids, shampoo and plastic chairs for her new salon

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia is 42 years old and married to Agnes.  Together they are blessed with two children, who are in school.

He has a business of selling charcoal in Naivasha that he has been running for five years.  He has applied for his first loan from Kadet ltd to enable him buy more stocks of charcoal. He earns an average monthly income of KES 40,000, and he intends to use the anticipated profit from his expanded business to open another charcoal shop.

In the near future, he hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 44 years old and from Sakutiek.  She is married and has six children, who are all in school.

Mary is a farmer.  She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy seedlings and fertilizer to use on her farm. Mary is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan. 

She hopes to be a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years old, divorced and has six children who are in school.

She has a charcoal and grocery business in Naivasha that she has been running for four years with an average income of 30,000 KES. Eunice has applied for her first loan that will enable her to purchase charcoal and additional stock such as bananas, potatoes and tomatoes. With her anticipated profit, Eunice plans to improve her business and pay school fees.

In the near future, Eunice hopes to be financially stable and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and additional stock such as bananas, potatoes,and tomatoes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 41 years old and from Sakutiek.  He is married and has six children who are all in school. Joseph is a farmer and has been in farming for many years. 

Joseph has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers. He is optimistic that his farm will do well after the loan. He hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Regina Wairimu

texts.en:
Regina is 66 years old and from Naivasha.  She is married with four children, who are in school.

Regina is a farmer and has been farming for many years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy seedlings and fertilizer. She hopes to have a bumper harvest from her farm.

She hopes to expand her farm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: This marks Abraham's third loan to finance his business. He has since expanded and will use the borrowed money to purchase timber stock in bulk from a neighboring country to help cut cost and improve his profit. He plans to own a timber yard in future.

loans.use: to purchase more timber stock to sell.

loans.name: Tajeu

texts.en:
Tajeu is 40 years old and from Naivasha. He is married and has two children who are in school. Tajeu is a farmer and has been farming for more than 10 years. 

Tajeu has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy fertilizers and seedlings for use in his farm. He hopes to enlarge his farm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: William Ondiko

texts.en:
William is 42 years old from Nakuru. He is divorced and blessed with two children, ages 13 and 8 years old who are in school.

He is a farmer who specializes in growing crops, such as kale, potatoes, and tomatoes, which he sells at the local market. To ensure that he gets the maximum yields from his farm, William would like to spray his crops with some herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer. Buying these chemicals will be facilitated by the loan he applied for from Kadet Ltd. of KES 11,000, which is his first loan.

His monthly income right now is KES 15,000, and he intends to use the profits from his expanded business to start a general store and educate his children.

He hopes for a healthy family and a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy some insecticides, herbicides, and fertilizer to spray his crops (kales, potatoes and tomatoes).

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old and from Naivasha.  He is married, with six children.

Joseph is a farmer and has been farming for some years.  He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizer to use on his farm.

He hopes to be the leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 36 years old, male and married. He has five children, 12, 9, 7, 5 and 3 years old, respectively, whom he supports. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a  KADET officer, and he is a fishmonger. He has been in this business for 14 years; it is located at Malindi. In his business, he earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES [Kenyan shillings]. 

He is taking his first loan of 20,000 KES, which he intends to use in adding stock to his business by buying more fish. Alfred will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future in business and his family are to educate his children and live a better life.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is 43 years old and married to Marith.  Together they are blessed with three children, who are in school.

He has a retail shop in Naivasha that he has been running for three years, with an average monthly income of KES 30,000.  He has applied for his first loan from Kadet ltd to enable him purchase more stocks such as sugar, rice, flour, among other items. He intends to use the anticipated profit from his expanded business to boost his business.

In the near future, he hopes to see his children well educated.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks, such as sugar, rice, flour, among other items

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a 54-year-old married father of six children, all of whom are in school, has been operating  a transport business in Naivasha for the past year, earning an average monthly income of ksh 40,000. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet to enable him to service his car. With the anticipated profit from his expanded business, he plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, David hopes to be financially stable and be able to educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: To service his car.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man, age 53 years, and blessed with seven children. He has been practicing livestock keeping for the past 35 years, and earning an average monthly income of KES 50,000.  

With his first loan of KES 30,000, he hopes to purchase additional livestock for keeping in the farm for milk production. The profits he earns will then be used to pay school fees for his children and repay the loan.

His dream is to become a major milk supplier in town.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 52 years old, married, and together they are blessed with four children who are in school.

She has a business of selling livestock in Naivasha, which she has been running for thirty three years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to purchase goats and sheep for sale. With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to become a large scale dealer and see her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Melissa Ysabel

texts.es:
Melissa es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica,en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Melissa se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Farmacia.
Por iniciativa propia, Melissa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Melissa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, como cosméticos, perfumes, cremas y otros, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Melissa is a single woman of 20 years living in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her parents and siblings. She is hardworking, enthusiastic, and devoted to her efforts to get ahead. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Melissa is studying for a pharmacy career. 
On her own initiative, Melissa works on her small business of selling beauty products. She works everyday for about 8 hours and believes she is doing well for her dedication and effort. 
Melissa is grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support she can buy more quantity and variety of goods such as cosmetics, perfumes, creams, and others so she can continue to work and strive to achieve her goal to be a good professional.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, perfumes, creams, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Edison Jhorgino

texts.es:
Edison es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edison no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios y eso le ha dificultado bastante para estudiar una profesión.
Por iniciativa propia, Edison trabaja como obrero en una empresa metalúrgica de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Edison se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará un televisor para sus hermanos pequeños, ya que desea brindarles algo de distracción luego de todos sus quehaceres, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Edison is a 22-year-old man, single, who lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and has a great desire to achieve. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and because he had to work, Edison was unable to finish secondary school, which has made it quite difficult for him to study a profession. Of his own initiative, Edison works in a metallurgical company in his city. He works every day, about 10 hours per day, and thinks that things are going well for him due to his dedication and effort.

Edison is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy a television for his little siblings. He wants to give them a distraction after all the things they have to do. And so he will keep working and pushing himself to achieve his great dream of finishing his studies.

loans.use: to buy a television

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 47 years old and from Kamakwa, which is in Nyandarua South. She is married, and together they have three children aged between 15 years and 9 years.

Rahab has a grocery business that she has been running for two years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy more peas to add to her stock. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan.

She hopes to diversify to dairy farming in the near future, as it is very profitable and easy to manage. This will boost the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy green peas to add to her stock.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is 29-years-old, a male and married. He has three (3) children 7, 5 and 2 years old respectively whom he supports. He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer.

For the last three years, Furaha has sold water in Kijiwetanga.  For his business he earns a monthly income of ksh.10,000. He is taking his fifth loan of ksh.40,000 which he intends to use to buy a water tank.  His previous loan of ksh. 20,000 he paid back successfully.

Furaha will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es una mujer de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edith no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Edith trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella vende potajes típicos de su ciudad y puede trabajar todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, Edith se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Edith se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea cercar la parte trasera de su hogar con materiales adecuados y resistentes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda en mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Edith is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and their four children. She is enthusiastic and a very hard worker, and she dedicates all of her effort to bringing her family forward. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need for her to work, Edith was not able to go to school to get a professional job.

By her own initiative, Edith works at her small food stand. She sells the traditional soups of her city and she works every day for about 10 hours. Edith enjoys her work and believes that it is going well due to her dedication and efforts.

Edith is very thankful for Kiva lenders because, due to the support they provide, she will be able to improve her home. She hopes to enclose the backside of her home with tough, adequate materials. This way, she will be able to continue to work and make an effort to achieve her dream of having a better home for her family.

loans.use: to make improvements on her home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married lady, age 57, and blessed with 5 children whom she supports. They are between 22 and 13 years old.
She is a livestock farmer in Tenges location, and has been in operation for the past 20 years, earning an income of KES 25,000 monthly.

She joined KADET Ltd., and now servicing her first term loan of KES 30,000, which she wishes to use to purchase additional livestock that will help her increase milk production, thus increase income. The profits she gets will be used to repay the loan and improve the living standards of her family.

Her dream is to be successful both in business and with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her home

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 35 years old, married, and together they are blessed with two children, ages thirteen and eight years old.

She has a retail shop in Naivasha, which she has been running for five years. She has applied for a second loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy stock, such as sugar, rice, flour, among others, and intends to use the anticipated profits from the expanded business to pay for school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to grow her business financially to a greater level.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, among others.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 21 años,vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jose no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Jose trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicacion y esfuerzo.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para obtener el seguro que requiere para seguir circulando en su moto, la cual utiliza para transportarse hacia su trabajo, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jose is a 21-year-old man who lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial district, with his wife and small child. He's hard working and enthusiastic and dedicates all of his efforts to getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, for financial reasons, instead of studying a career, he was forced to work. 
By his own initiative, Jose works as a laborer on a ranch in his city. He works approximately 10 hours a day, every day. The dedication to his work and the effort he puts in, lead him to believe it's going well. 
Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they've given him. It has enabled him to cover the insurance required to continue using his motorbike to get to work, and that way, he's able to continue working and making the effort in order to realize his dream of owning his own house.

loans.use: cover the insurance for his motorbike, so he can get himself to work.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 51 years old and from Nyandarua. He is married with two children, aged 14 years and 5 years old.

John has a paraffin business that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more paraffin to add to his stock.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more paraffin to add to his stock.

loans.name: Juan Abner

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 30 años,vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su pequeña hija,el es padre soltero, trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Juan no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Juan trabaja en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada Juan realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que construirá dos habitaciones de adobe para su familia, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de darle una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Juan is a 30-year-old man who lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial district, with his young daughter. He is a single father, hardworking and enthusiastic, with a great desire to achieve. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and because he had to work, Juan could not study a professional degree. 

Juan works in a small business he started himself, raising and selling guinea pigs. He works every day, about 10 hours, and thinks that it is going well for him because of his dedication and effort. Juan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as it is thanks to the help they offer that Juan will be able to improve his house. He is going to build two adobe rooms for his family, and so he will continue working and pushing himself to achieve his great dream of giving his daughter a good education.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar según referencias es una persona trabajadora de condición muy humilde, lleva trabajando desde muy joven como metalúrgico, pero actualmente desempeña la labor en el transporte público, es así que hoy  en día trabaja con una línea de Taxitrufi, hoy solicita el presente crédito para la refacción de la vivienda que habita, para realizar mejoras al interior del mismo, inmueble  que está ubicado en  una zona que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos; indica que con el crédito que se le otorgue le ayudara a concretar las aspiraciones que tiene de superación personal y/o familiar. El Sr. Cesar de estado civil soltero, pero cuenta con un hijo quien aun depende de su ingreso económico y por quien desea seguir trabajando para así poder generar mayores ingresos con el fin de brindarle la mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
According to references, Cesar is a hard working person of a humble condition.  He has worked since he was very young as a metallurgist, but he currently works in public transportation.  He works with the Taxitrufi line.  

Today he is requesting this loan to renovate his home, by making improvements to the interior of the building.  It is located in an area that has all the basic services.  

He indicates that with this loan, you will help him to realize the aspirations that he has personally or with his family.  Cesar is single, but has a son who depends on his income.  For him, he would like to continue working to generate greater income to provide him with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his home

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, es madre de una pequeña de 9 años a la cual quiere y mucho y por quien cada día se esfuerza mucho en su pequeño negocio de costura, en el cual trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes al día.

Beatriz esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una máquina de coser y de esta manera poder atender mejor  sus clientes y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su  gran sueño:” Tener una casa propia y darle una profesión a su hija”.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is the mother to a 9 year old daughter who she loves very much and for whom she makes an effort every day in her small sewing business. 

She works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 10 clients a day. 

Beatriz is thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help she has been able to buy a sewing machine, can serve her clients better and  increase her income. 

She will keep fighting to make her dream of having her own house and giving her daughter a profession come true.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Isabel Soledad

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Isabel no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Isabel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de flores y arreglos florales, ella trabaja afuera de un cementerio en su ciudad y lo hace todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas.
Isabel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de flores para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Isabel, 40, lives in the city of Chincha with her son. She is a hardworking single mother who puts all her efforts into supporting her family. Sadly, Isabel didn't have the money to study a profession and needed to work. On her own, Isabel runs a small florist shop and works near the city cemetery every day for about 10 hours. 

Isabel thanks the Kiva lenders, whose funding will let her buy a wider range of flowers for her business. She will keep working hard to achieve her great dream of seeing her son become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a wider range of flowers.

loans.name: Sandro Yvan

texts.es:
Sandro vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa y trabaja como empleado de seguridad en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, Sandro trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y con e fruto de su trabajo puede salir adelante cada día,  asimismo con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa, con lo cual tienen un dinero extra para poder salir adelante; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Sandro agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de ropa como polos, short, pantalones, entre otros; de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un local propio y ser un gran microempresario”.
texts.en:
Sandro lives in Pucallpa and works as a security guard for a small business in his city. Sandro works around 10 hours a day, and the money he earns means he is able to get by each day. At the same time he has worked hard to start his own clothing business, which brings in extra money. He believes that his business is going well because he is very responsible.

Sandro is grateful for the support of the Kiva lenders, as thanks to them he will be able to buy merchandise for his business, including shirts, shorts, trousers and others. This means he can increase his earnings and fight to make his dream of having his own premises and becoming a successful small business owner come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his clothing business.

loans.name: Astrid Carolina

texts.es:
Astrid es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y su pequeño hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Astrid no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Astrid trabaja en un mercado de su ciudad vendiendo comida, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Astrid se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una mesa para comer y un ropero donde pueda guardar y proteger de la humedad las prendas de vestir de su hijo, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Astrid, 21, lives in Ica in the Parcona district with her parents and young son. She is a hardworking single mother who puts all her effort into supporting her family. Sadly, she didn't have the money to study a profession and needed to work instead. Astrid works on her own selling food at a city market. She works every day for about 10 hours and believes things are going well because she is dedicated and works hard.

Astrid thanks the Kiva lenders, whose funding will let her buy a table and a closet, where she can store and protect her son's clothing from the humidity. She will keep working hard to achieve her great dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy a table and closet.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en concubinato con su pareja, tiene una hija pequeña, económicamente es independiente, percibe ingresos económicos de la actividad agrícola, ella produce papa y locoto, siembran en terreno de 2 Has, el terreno donde siembra es herencia de sus padres con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el sector agrícola. La Sra Martha requiere el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico y productos agroquímicos, con los cambios climáticos los cultivos necesitan más cuidado debido a los cambios climáticos. Sra Martha podrá incrementar mas la siembra de papa y locoto, además de contribuir en la seguridad alimentaria de la región y a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Martha lives in the community of Colomi and is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner has a young daughter and is economically independent.  
 
She receives income from her agricultural activity.  She produces potatoes and green peppers, growing them on her 2 hectares of land.  She inherited this land from her parents who had experience in the agricultural sector from rotating crops. 

Martha is requesting this loan to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemicals.  With the climate changes, the crops need better care.  Martha could increase the planting of these potatoes and peppers, in addition to contributing to food security of the region and at the national level.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemical products

loans.name: Maria Genara

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque quiere salir adelante y es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de menestras desde hace 8 años, Maria cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo muy trabajadora.
Maria esta agradecida con el apoyo brindado por los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio y de esta manera poder tener más productos para ofrecer, así ella mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
María’s a very hardworking woman above all because she must get ahead and this is why she started selling vegetable stew 8 years ago.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s very kind to customers and above all because she’s very hardworking.

María’s grateful for the support provided by Kiva lenders because thanks to it she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business and have more products to offer.  She will thus improve income and continue striving to make her dream reality: to own a minimarket.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: El señor Federico es casado más de 17 años, tiene 2 hijos dependientes de diferentes edades que estudian en nivel primaria y secundaria, son una familia humilde viven en la comunidad de Colomi hace 6 años atrás, son agricultores con ingresos económicos estacionales por la venta de papa, papaliza, oca y haba en vaina verde.  El señor Federico y su familia son de escasos recursos económicos que a veces apenas cubre los gastos para el estudio de sus hijos, además  gastaron el ahorro que tenía en obra fina de la construcción de su vivienda, ahora Federico junto a su esposa  necesitan dinero para hacer otra vivienda económica de madera en su chaco del trópico, por este motivo solicita un préstamo para la construcción de la vivienda de madera en su chaco.
texts.en:
Federico has been married for more than 17 years and has two dependent children of different ages.  They are in primary and secondary school.  They are a humble family that has lived in the community of Colomi for 6 years.  

They work in agriculture and with their seasonal income, sell potatoes, tuber vegetables, variations of potatoes, and green bean pods.  

Federico and his family are from scarce economic resources that sometimes just covers the school costs for their children.  They spent the money they saved on construction in their home.  Now, Federico and his wife are requesting a loan to make another affordable wooden home in their tropical region.

loans.use: to construct a wooden house

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, la cual se encuentra al norte de la Capital de Perú. Luis es un hombre que con mucho esfuerzo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de producción y venta de adobe, desde hace muchos años, y con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su familia.

Luis agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá mejorar su negocio ya que podrá comprar más espacio donde poder confeccionar los adobes y comprar herramientas como barretas, combas, entre otros, así el podrá seguir luchando por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener una empresa ladrillera y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the city of Guadalupe which is located north of Peru’s capital.  He’s a man who with much effort works in his small business manufacturing adobe bricks.  He’s been in business many years and uses the income earned from his humble work to cover his family’s expenses.

Luis is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide because thanks to their help he will be able to improve his business for he will buy more space in which to manufacture the adobe bricks and will buy tools like crowbars and rope, among others to continue striving to make his dream reality: to own a brick factory and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, el trabaja como en su negocio de producción y venta de adobes, Jorge trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede obtener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Jorge está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una moto con la cual podrá movilizarse para poder ir a trabajar y de esta manera ahorrar y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una gran empresa ladrillera”.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in the city of Guadalupe.  He works at his business making and selling bricks.  Jorge works around 10 hours a day and the fruit of his labor provides him with income to cover his household expenses. 

Jorge is thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to the help they have offered him that he will be able to buy a motorcycle to get around and go to work.  This will allow him to save up and keep working toward making his greatest dream a reality: to have a large-scale brick-making business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Nicolas, es una persona de 43 años de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con cuatro dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus pequeños hijos, vive en su propio domicilio de tipo rustico construido con material local revocado con barro, que se halla situado en la comunidad de Tíraque, su actividad económica es la agrícola en tal sentido produce los siguientes productos agrícolas; como ser papa 150 cargas, oca  40 cargas y también avena 17 carmas, todos los productos agrícolas son cultivados en una superficie de 3,5 Has. lo cuales cuentan con riego y que es aplicado pro inundación, en ese entendido el señor Nicolas  se ve obligado a solicitar capital de operación para poder comprar semilla de papa y abono orgánico, de esa manera en el futuro mejorarán sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo de sus dependientes económicos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 43 years old and in a civil union.  He reached primary school and has four economically dependent children.  He lives in his own rustic style home that he constructed with local material and clay.  His home is located in the community of Tíraque.  

He works in agriculture where he produces agricultural products.  He produces 150 loads of potatoes, 40 loads of oca, and 17 loads of oats, and all these agricultural products are cultivated on an area of 3.5 hectares.  

These count on irrigation because of flooding.  With that understanding, he is forced to apply for operating capital to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer.  In this way, he can better his income in the future and at the same time, better the lives of his economic dependents.

loans.use: to buy potato plants and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Leydi Miriam

texts.es: Leydi es una persona joven, vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la casa de sus padres, es la hermana mayor de tres hermanas. Es una persona muy responsable dedicada a su familia y trabajo. Ella estudió y trabaja apoyando en la cría de cerdos a su padre.  Debido a que necesitaba generar mayores  ingresos para su sustento diario, trabajo y trabajo para ahorrar un poco de dinero y de esta manera pudo abrir su propio negocio vendiendo golosinas y otros. Actualmente su negocio ha crecido pero necesita invertir más dinero y así tenga un negocio sólido para su sustento. Entre sus planes futuros Leydi planea sacar un nuevo crédito para concluir sus estudios.
texts.en:
Leydi is a young person who lives in the city of Cochabamba in her parents house.  She is the oldest sister of three sisters.  She is a very responsible person who is dedicated to her family and her work.

She studied and worked helping raise pigs for her father. Since she needed to generate more income for her family, she works and was able to save a little money and open her own store selling snacks and other things.  

Now her business has grown but she needs to invest more money to have a solid business that will sustain her.  

 Among other future plans, Leydi plans to use her new credit to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her neighborhood store

loans.name: Harrieth

texts.es: La señora Harrieth es una madre soltera con un bebe de 5 meses de nacido, la señora vive en la casa de su madre, la señora cuenta con una tienda de venta de material escolar que esta cerca de un colegio que con gran esfuerzo a logrado hacer para poder poner dicha tienda. Como aun le falta capital por que  sus ventas son bajas por no estar surtida su tienda, la señora necesita el crédito para poder surtir su tienda y así incrementar sus ventas y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y darle mejores condiciones a su hijo ya que no percibe la ayuda de el padre y la situación de trabajar con un bebe es difícil en estos días, el único sustento y ayuda que puede recibir es de su propio esfuerzo y de las ventas que realiza en su tienda
texts.en:
Harrieth is a single mother with a five-month-old baby. She lives in her mother's home. She has a shop where she sells school supplies, and this shop is located close to a school. It took a lot of effort to be able to open her store.

Her sales have been low because she lacks working capital, so the store isn't well-stocked. Harrieth needs this loan so that she can stock her shop, and increase her sales in this way. This will enable her to improve her quality of life and give her son better living conditions, since she doesn't get any help from her baby's father, and it is difficult to both work and have a baby these days. Harrieth can only obtain support and help through her own efforts and from the sales she makes at her store.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en el distrito de Mocupe, un distrito que se caracteriza por dedicarse a la agricultura y comercio a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que está ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, pollo, abarrotes y juegos mecánicos en el interior del mercado de Mocupe, ha solicitado un crédito de 1 500 nuevos soles para surtir su negocio con la compra abarrotes arroz, azúcar y otros, de esta manera tener ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Mocupe district, which is known to its farming and businesses.  She lives two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region along the north coast of Peru.

Carmen Rosa works in the Mocupe indoor market selling vegetables, chicken, groceries, and toys.  She is asking for a 1,500 sol loan so as to stock her business.  She will buy groceries such as rice, sugar, and other things.  In this way, she will be able to have additional income for her family.

loans.use: buy groceries.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su hija y sus padres en la comunidad de Zaña, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, que pertenece a la ciudad de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, también ofrece servicio de jornales agrícolas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en compra de animales pequeños para que posteriormente los engorde y ofrezca a mejor precio y la otra parte para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos agrícolas.

Luzmila confía en Edpyme Alternativa, anteriormente había solicitado un préstamo que le sirvió para iniciar su negocio y le ha permitido aportar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luzmila, age 27, lives with her daughter and her parents in the Zaña community.  The population devotes itself to agriculture and commerce.  The community is in the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals.  She also does farm work.  She has requested a loan for 4,000 soles in order to buy small animals.  She will later fatten them and sell them for a better price.  She will use the other part to provide maintenance to her crops.

Luzmila relies on Edpyme Alternantiva.  She had previously requested a loan that she used to start her business.  It has allowed her to contribute income to her family.

loans.use: to buy animals and provide maintenance to her crops.

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es:
Cesar Eduardo tiene 20 años de edad, vive junto a su madre en la comunidad de Cayalti, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida, Cesar se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores y ofrece servicio de jornales agrícolas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños y alimentos balanceados para engorde y tendrá mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Eduardo is 20 years old. He lives with his mother in the community of Cayalti. The people there work in agriculture and raising small animals. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo that is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.

They are a close family. Cesar raises and sells small animals and offers agricultural  day labor services. He has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy small animals and balanced feed so he can fatten them up and have more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products from Barley. Her income from the loan helped in her everyday household expenditures. She also sells fabric conditioner for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of Barley products. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Felicisima dreams that her business will grow bigger, and hopes that her children will reach their dreams. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of Barley products.

loans.name: Nataly Judith

texts.es:
Nataly Judith tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hija en la zona urbana de Zaña, un distrito que se caracteriza por el comercio de animales menores y la agricultura, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de carneros y aves de corral en la parte posterior de su vivienda, también ofrece tubérculos y verduras, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y venderlos a un mejor precio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nataly Judith is 24 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter in the urban area of Zaña. It is a district characterized by the businesses of small animals and farming. It belongs to the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising sheep and poultry behind her house. She also offers tubers and vegetables. She has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy small animals to later fatten them up and sell them at a better price, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Jose Rosas

texts.es:
José Rosas tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad rural de Querocotillo, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de ganado vacuno, que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la siembra de arroz de la variedad moro sembrando 1 ha de arroz de su propiedad esta actividad la realiza hace 30 años, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, tiene comprador mayorista en la zona “Estalin”. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles el destino del crédito será para siembra y mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buena producción y mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Rosas, 37, lives with his wife in a rural community in Querocotillo in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region of the northern sierra of Peru.  The people there make a living in agriculture and selling cattle.

José grows one hectare of the Moro variety of rice on his property.  He has done this work for 30 years and has a lot of experience in the area.  He has a wholesale buyer in the Estalin area.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to plant and take care of his crop.  This way he'll get a good crop and more income for his family.

loans.use: to take care of his crops

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more used-but-still-good clothes for her business, which she has run for seven years now. The loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted in their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 33,000 loan to buy more used-but-still-good clothes for her business.
